result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy L. Chopper

defendant.name: Chopper, Timothy L.
defendant.address: W20421 County Road H, Strum, WI

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:23 AM Cases called: 22CF1030, 22CF806 & 22CF427. Defendant Timothy L. Chopper in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Timothy L. Chopper.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

22CF1030: Waives reading of the criminal complaint. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. State requests a $500 cash bond. Defense requests a signature bond. Court orders that bond in 22CF427 cover this case as well with additional conditions.

All 3 cases are set for a Status Conference 12/05/22 at 2pm in person for 30 min.
Status conference on September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cases called at 9:00 AM: 22CF1030, 22CF806, 22CF427.  Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Timothy L. Chopper appeared via telephone.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad appeared via telephone for Timothy L. Chopper.  District Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Off record for Attorney Hillestad to speak privately with the Defendant in a breakout room. Defendant waives his right to personal appearance. 
22CF806: Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties. Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing.
22CF427: Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of Informations and enters Not Guilty pleas in both 22CF427 and 22CF806.
Parties agree to hear the Initial Appearance in 22CF1030 in person at a later date.
STC/Initial Appearance: 9/29/22 at 9:30 AM (in person).

Conditions: 
No contact with D.Z., G.J.

Conditions: 
No contact with D.Z., G.J.

(2:51 PM cases 22CF427, 22CF806 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Timothy L. Chopper in court. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Timothy L. Chopper.
Parties advise are ready to proceed.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing in 22CF806.
22CF427: 
State requests the Court take judicial notice of the bond in case 19CF903. Attorney Hillestad advises has no objection. Court takes judicial notice of the bond in case 19CF903.
State calls Detective Mike Osmond of the Buffalo County Sheriff's Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Hillestad conducts cross-examination of Detective Osmond. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over. Attorney Hillestad makes argument against bind over.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Hillestad to schedule an Arraignment in case 22CF427 and a Hearing in case 22CF806 with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cases called at 1:46 PM: 22CF427, 22CF806. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Timothy L. Chopper appeared by phone and without counsel. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Court notes the Public Defender's Office is still in the process of appointing counsel for the Defendant.
Court orders the matters adjourned to next week.
Preliminary Hearing/Initial Appearance: 8/2/22 at 1:30 PM.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.
